word_mean: 〔复sinus，sinuses〕窦：解剖学上对象颅腔、肝脏内静脉血管的膨大部分或颅骨内含气腔的通名
窦道：脓液流出的异常管道或瘘管

sentence.Network_en: I still suffer from catarrh and sinus problems.
sentence.Network_cn: 我仍然患有黏膜炎和鼻窦炎。

sentence.Network_en: Sinus arrhythmia also tends to disappear with advancing age.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着年龄的增长,窦性心律不齐也趋于消失.

sentence.Network_en: This normal variation in rhythm is known as sinus arrhythmia.
sentence.Network_cn: 节律的这种正常变化称为窦性心律失常.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the medical sense): from Latin, literally a recess, bend'

entry.def: Your sinuses are the spaces in the bone behind your nose.

example.ex: I still suffer from catarrh and sinus problems.
example.tran: 我仍然患有黏膜炎和鼻窦炎。

means.word_mean: 1. an abnormal passage leading from a suppurating cavity to the body surface
2. any of various air-filled cavities especially in the bones of the skull
3. a wide channel containing blood; does not have the coating of an ordinary blood vessel

auth_sentence.content: He has almost no sense of smell since sinus surgery.

in+sinuate[adj.弯弯曲曲的,波状的]→v.暗指,暗示
